algorithm_technique: Construct the first half of the palindrome based on the query and intLength, then mirror it.
Calculate the first half of the palindrome using powers of 10 and string concatenation.
problem_summary_simple: Find the k-th smallest palindrome of a given length.
problem_summary_technical: Constructs palindromes by determining the first half based on query and length, then mirroring.
key_insights: Palindromes are constructed by defining their first half and mirroring it.
The number of digits in the first half depends on `intLength` (odd vs. even).
The `queries[i]` value directly maps to the `queries[i]`-th number that forms the first half.
The base for the first half is `10^((intLength-1)//2)`.
The `queries[i]`-th palindrome is formed by `base + queries[i] - 1`.
String slicing and concatenation are efficient for building the palindrome.
